DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Agent Without Modification or Adjustment Administered Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator to specify whether a study agent intervention was administered as specified per protocol without modification, delay or adjustment [manually curated].

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Protocol Agent Without Modification or Adjustment Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the trial, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._An indication that a change in treatment or a change to a device will be required following an adverse event._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.:An indication that a change in treatment or a change to a device will be required following an adverse event.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
An indication that a change in treatment or a change to a device will be required following an adverse event.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Needed new concept for CDE to indicate study intervention administered without modification. [lf-5/18/2016]

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Treatment within 28 days of PD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was treatment started within 28 days of progressive disease (PD)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was study drug administered a
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was study drug administered as specified per protocol without modification or delay?
